sharply.translation[0].definitions[0].de: suddenly and by a large amount
sharply.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Prices have risen sharply over the last few months.
His politics have moved sharply to the right.
sharply.translation[0].definitions[1].de: in a disapproving or unfriendly way
sharply.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: ‘What do you mean by that?’ Paul asked sharply.
sharply.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Graham looked up sharply, startled by a noise behind him.
Emily drew in her breath sharply.
sharply.translation[0].definitions[3].de: used when saying that two things are clearly and noticeably very different
sharply.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: His beliefs and values contrast sharply with  (=are very different from) his father’s.
sharply.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: The value of early photographs has risen sharply in recent years.
These measures could sharply reduce pollution from road traffic.
